sub_title: engaging organizations to succeed future proof cultural transformation
summary:
I am a powerhouse with over 30 years of all-round experience in organizations of between 12.000 and 280.000 employees. I love working on Cultural Transformation & Change journeys in the service industry and supporting my clients to achieve their desired business results by creating the optimal employee experience.
 
So get in touch with me if your organization needs:
o Strategic advice on culture change & transformation or on how to build a strong future proof organisation
o Engage and mobilize the leaders in the organization for cultural change
o To assist with the roll out of the transformation
o To innovate your Employee Experience resulting in higher engagement and the desired Guest Experience
 
 
Sustainable Transformation is only possible with the following ingredients:
•	A daring mindset
•	Engaged people
•	A clear purpose
•	The belief we will and can do it
•	Finding your early adapters and involve and empower them

treasury_media.title: I'm a heartist
treasury_media.description:
Heartist journey made for them! Our employees, our heartists...Real voices. Real stories. Straight from the heart.
Listen to what our heartists have being a Heartist.

treasury_media.title: 16. The Heartist Journey of Accor - No More Boring Learning
treasury_media.description: Jeanne talks with Caro van Eekelen - Senior Vice President Learning &  Transformation at Accor Hotels. They talk about  the Transformation Journey that they undertook in more than 92 countries , 280000 employees, 40 brands. Listen to this exciting adventure.

treasury_media.title: atd 2020 virtual informa 720
treasury_media.description: In 2016 I was asked to start with the hard needed transformation for all brands at accor. We build the Heartist journey. here you can see the story, how we build it, how it worked for 92 different countries, 280000 employees and 4o diffferent brands.

treasury_media.title: Caro van Eekelen (Accor HotelServices Benelux) - Wo.Men@Work Award 2014
treasury_media.description:
I was nominated for the Belgium Wo.Men@Work Award 2014 and talked about a topic that matters to me: diversity and inclusion. At Accor we strongly believe in this and strive for it every day. 
By experience, we know that diverse teams outperform those who aren’t. Conviction is not enough; it’s crucial to put diversity and inclusion high on the agenda. Making diversity discussable, putting in place concrete actions and fix targets for leaders in the company and holding them accountable.

school.name: School for Hospitality Management The Hague

organizations.name: Blooming Hotel ‘t hof en Blooming Beach

profile_positions.description: Leadership | employee experience | guest experience | business acumen
profile_positions.title: Cultural Transformation

profile_positions.description:
blooming makes people bloom: leisure and business guests and collegues.
The place to be to be offline in the middle of beautiful nature, with exceptional food from own gardens and with passionte people who give heartwarming service❤️
profile_positions.title: Bloomer

profile_positions.description:
My main focus when I started this position was to create and design the Cultural Transformation journey for 250000 employees, which was necessary since guests are expecting personal experiences. This journey gives them the means to be free to make heartwarming connections with our guests. This is the HEARTIST journey: HEART + ARTIST. It is centered around the passion and uniqueness of each person, and the idea that building a great employee experience is necessary to build great guest experience and boost results. 

After this, I started working on the Transformation of Learning at Accor. The aim is that learning becomes a way of life. We designed and gave them the tools to transform and learn - where all 250000 employees could grow. 

Within more than 35 brands of Accor, the HEARTIST journey gives us a shared identity, principles and values on how we deliver our guest experiences while keeping the uniqueness of each brand intact.

Between 2018 and 2019, more than 2000 of our hotels across 5 continents already implemented the HEARTIST journey.
profile_positions.title: SVP Transformation, Learning & Development

profile_positions.description:
As COO of 116 hotels (all segments)  my role was to ensure optimal Business results and Hotel Growth by Transforming Hotel Development, Public Image, Revenue Management, Marketing, Sales & Distribution, , HR Employee Engagement & Growth,  Employer Branding, , Procurement, Business Optimization, and Operations. 

As a result, we doubled the number hotels. We succeeded in implementing our asset-light strategy in sell/management back. We jumped from 25 to the 8th position in ‘great place to work’ ranking. At the time, we were known as the best hotel employer in the Netherlands.
We transformed our support functions to service providers.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer Benelux

profile_positions.description:
As COO of 54 hotels (all segments)  my role was to ensure optimal Business results and Hotel Growth by Transforming Hotel Development, Public Image, Revenue Management, Marketing, Sales & Distribution, , HR Employee Engagement & Growth,  Employer Branding, , Procurement, Business Optimization, and Operations. 

As a result, we doubled the number of franchise hotels. We succeeded in implementing our asset-light strategy in sell/management back. We jumped from 25 to the 8th position in ‘great place to work’ ranking. At the time, we were known as the best hotel employer in the Netherlands.
We transformed our support functions to service providers.

As the first female Managing Director within Accor, one of my highlights was the signing of the Talent to the Top Charter, during a conference on Diversity and Leadership. This was a promise to recruit, promote and retain female talent, with the aim of representing it equally in top positions, even try to mobilize people to take initiative outside the company. I committed to leading 5 guest lectures for students of14 years old, to inspire them and make them think in possibilities and opportunities by telling them my story.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer the Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
The Brand was created in 2007, a joint venture between Accor and Pierre& Vacances that started with 16 Apart Hotels. From 2007-2009, we opened 14 Apart Hotels more all over Europe.

My role was transforming Adagio from a French to an International Company, by successfully transform the culture, set up a consistent Brand Guest Experience and  create a strong  empowered leadership culture in order to improve business results.
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer, Adagio Apart Hotels

profile_positions.description:
During my Board Membership at Blooming we developed the Blooming culture, the blooming guest and employee experience with the right leadership, we improved the business results through better positioning, higher guest and employee satisfaction. stainable is. Also giving back is in the DNA of Blooming.  The blooming group has a special shareholder: the blooming foundation. The shareholder has included in its statute that a portion of the profits are to be given back to our environment and the region through the blooming foundation. The board of the foundation determines which educational and social projects the money is spent on. Thus, we contribute to a fair, sustainable and socially responsible society. blooming works together with Scorlewald, an anthroposophic healthcare institution where people with a disadvantage live and work.

The Hoftuin, the gardens at the estate, is the working ground of  Scorlewald. Scorlewald residents grow vegetables, fruits and flowers there which are used by blooming hotel, 'landgoed Het Hof' and blooming beach. In order for the shareholder to perform these particular tasks, blooming needs to be a profitable business. But there is also another purpose in that commercial goal: blooming wants to deliver a socio-cultural contribution and work towards a sustainable future in almost all ways. So, for example, purchasing, energy supply, waste management, human resources and choice of suppliers is done out of that philosophy.

blooming continues to grow and flourish. We are blooming.
profile_positions.title: Member Of The Supervisory Board

profile_positions.description:
As a Board Member I focused on the 30 different curriculums and made sure they fit the needs of the business.  And the focus was on the voice of 10 000 students on the quality of the learning experience. The thing I loved about Stenden was not only the international mix of  students but also the possibility for students to do a part of their studies abroad at different international Campuses in the world.


About Stenden/NHL:
Our educational concept combines an interdisciplinary approach with a practical focus. This means you get real-world assignments to solve. The practical application of your own innovative solutions is at the core of this method. This way of working has been in the DNA of both institutions, so continuing down that fruitful path is the obvious choice to make.  

If you enrol at Stenden, you will join both Dutch and international students like yourself. It is a truly international experience. You will be prepared for a dynamic world, and ready to cross borders. We are looking forward to guiding you on your journey towards becoming a full-fledged professional.
profile_positions.title: Member Of The Supervisory Board

profile_positions.description:
During my last 5 years in this role, I was in charge of optimizing staff costs for all operational functions. All planning, labor budgets and modeling were my responsibility. I also performed recruitment forecasts, short and long-term. One of my main projects was ‘Hote d’Accueil Touristique’ program, where along with the Ministry of Labor and Disneyland Paris, created a French certification for employees who did not have a diploma at the time. We created an 18-month learning journey through different functions, which earned them a diploma certified by the French Ministry of Labor. By the time I completed this role, 1200 employees had received the diploma.

I worked with Disneyland Paris ever since the opening of the Parks and resorts in 1992. During those first years, I worked in different roles including operations of hotels, Park and Disney Village and in HR - setting up development programs for 3500 employees.
profile_positions.title: Director Operational Labor Management, HR and Operations

profile_positions.description:
Opened different hotels and Resorts in Aruba (Dutch Antilles), Amsterdam, Paris and Accra in Ghana.
As Rooms Division Manager, I was in charge of setting up the Housekeeping department,  assuring that all employees were recruited and trained in time, and set a healthy climate to work in. In this function, it was important to make sure we gave them the purpose of delivering a great guest experience, beyond their assigned tasks.
profile_positions.title: Opening Expert in Rooms Division, Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: I was an ambassador for Talent naar de Top, a foundation with a social objective for more diverse talent in the (sub) top. The mission is to make diversity and inclusiveness at the top the norm, ensuring that the decision-making and performance of the company improve and that the talents of all employees are utilized.
